subtitle: Hello everyone so at the end of the chakra series that i did i was meant to give you a mantra,
a very powerful mantra sorry that i didn't give it sooner life gets in the way my cat distracts me
and all sorts of things so yes here it is i'm going to give it to you now you probably saw it on
one of the resources that i left towards the end of the series but yes here it is and it is called
the prajna paramita or also the heart sutra and this is one of many of the teachings that the
buddha left but this one you could say is when he uh revealed perhaps what is considered by many as
the most powerful mantra and it derives from this teaching of the heart sutra or the heart of
wisdom sutra you could say so this is called the prajna paramita so prajna means consciousness or
wisdom, wisdom in the sense of intuitive wisdom it translates you know to many different things
but that's the general idea this direct wisdom and consciousness of this wisdom and parameter
means perfection or that which has arrived at the other shore so prajna paramita wisdom
which is perfect or consciousness which has arrived at the other shore arrived at that
other place that we are really intuitively trying to reach so this is this intuitive wisdom
that perfectly reaches that other side that other side that is impossible to describe
the more we talk about it the more we are not pointing towards it the more we are
not understanding it because it cannot be understood by the intellect hence why
we have meditation right because we want to go beyond the intellect and so in order to do that
there is a mantra that has come from this teaching of the prajnaparamita the heart
sutra and the the mantra is
now sounds like a bit of a mouthful but it's actually quite simple to remember and it's a
really uh really beautiful mantra it is really you know one of my personal uh favorite mantras
especially because of the meaning of it and what it really entails and what it points to towards
the ultimate nature of our consciousness and the ultimate reality of our reality
and our experience and that which we can reach in our direct experience so it is pointing towards
the perfect knowledge and experience of this other shore and this other sure which you
may start to intuit as i'm describing it is about this void this illuminating reality this sunyata
the emptiness the nothingness the absolute the i in soft and it is through this experience of these
states is where we experience samadhi this total bliss this ecstasy the experience
that is without our ego right a lot of the time we perhaps think that we are not in ego
etc but really truly the experience of not having an ego is not about thinking that we don't have
an ego it is about the direct experience of this great reality the ultimate reality and we start to
experience that great reality in varying degrees and we can very much so experience it quite deeply
through meditation and particularly with this powerful mantra the gate geta paragate parasamgate
bodhi swaha and it is through this experience of samadhi and going to this ultimate reality
this great reality beyond the reality of our terrestrial life
beyond the reality of our dream realities and beyond the reality of our self and what we think
of ourself and the whole world it is to go beyond all of that and so it's really great because
this mantra and saying this mantra is akin to telling ourselves stop stop stop just carry
on just carry on just carry on keep going keep going keep going and that's what we need because
the thinking mind the intellect is always thinking thinking thinking doubting doubting doubting
always in confusion always speculating what was this thought i had what was this emotion i had
what do i think about the world these days what do i think of gene on astral doorway uh what are all
what about these buddhist theories these christian theories what about science and everything right
there is such a mess and such noise in our mind in our consciousness that it just
completely stops us from getting into any kind of profound meditative state and so this mantra is
essentially telling us go go go go beyond all of that go beyond your thinking go beyond your
dreaming go beyond the many sensations of the body go beyond the many sensations in our perception
keep going and stay in that you know our mind is like a muddy glass of water and we keep
shaking it and shaking it right and we can't see past that muddy glass of water
if we have so much agitation in the mind if we have so many beliefs so many theories so many
doubts and few confusions and thinking and so we want to keep going keep going keep going right
in our meditation we want to have that force that vigor and so this is what the mantra means
to stay still stay still be patient wait for the mud to settle at the bottom of the glass
so that you can see through it and you can see through the veil of illusion through the veil
of the ego and so that you can let your awareness let your consciousness arrive at that other shore
that's why it's called the prajnaparamita to have that perfect the wisdom that knowledge to
arrive at that other shore and to have this sort of simultaneous knowledge of this is me my body
my whole experience right my ego and then to also go beyond that and experience that which is the
great reality that which is called ain soph or you know call it god if you like this is about
entering into that doorway through which truth can be experienced not christian truth not
buddhist truth this is a buddhist mantra right but not hindu truth not my truth not your truth
universal truth pure untainted reality completely free from the stains and the colorations
of the ego and humanity just to go beyond all of that have that power that force
to forget all of this and submerge ourselves in the cosmic intelligence of
everything right and where does everything come from it comes from
nothing so this is the experience of that nothing that void but that illuminating void
we think a void is black but where does everything or where does light
come from it comes from the void it comes from darkness right so there are many
descriptions or interpretations of this mantra but i think the dalai lama gives one of the best
uh quick kind of descriptions about this so i'll put this on the screen and he says
in sanskrit tadyatha literally means it is thus and prepares the way for what follows gotta
means go go paragate means go beyond parasam gate means go totally beyond and bodhi swahar can be
read as be rooted in the ground of enlightenment thus the entire mantra itself can be translated as
go go go beyond go totally beyond be rooted in the ground of enlightenment we can interpret
this mantra metaphorically to read go to the other shore which is to say abandon this shore
of samsara an enlightened existence which has been our home since beginning of time and cross
to the other shore of final nirvana and complete liberation so this mantra is intended to be
like a key for unlocking our perception or our experience and realization of fundamental
reality so samayal one viol also says about this mantra the one who wants to experience the truth
must undoubtedly relax the body empty the mind and sing the mantra of the prajna parameter thus
one day you will achieve the experience of that which is not of time of that which is the truth
and the one who experiences the truth begins to work really truly with strength
on oneself the reason why you know he's saying that when we experience that truth that reality
there's almost no going back right because we have experienced the truth
for ourself and when we experience that and we open our heart to that
there's no other theorizing there's no other thinking hmm you know is was my theory correct or
maybe this life choice is bad or maybe i'm in the the wrong religion it's something that is
concrete within you that nobody no matter how clever their intellectual theorizing may be or
how clever their arguments may be they can't take that reality that truth of that reality of that
experience away from you because you experienced it and you experienced going to that other shore
going to that other side that we are so craving and longing for but the problem is you know
